unnormalised: IIT Delhi just released the stats from their entrance exam. Turns out, only like, 0.5% of applicants actually crack it. Can you believe it? My chacha was saying that back in his day, the pass percentage was way higher, something around 5%. Times have changed, I guess.
normalised: I-I-T Delhi just released the stats from their entrance exam. Turns out, only like, zero point five percent of applicants actually crack it. Can you believe it? My chacha was saying that back in his day, the pass percentage was way higher, something around five percent. Times have changed, I guess.

unnormalised: A recent survey by the National Statistical Office (NSO) shows that the average household income in Mumbai is about Rs. 30,000 per month, with a standard deviation of Rs. 10,000. They're saying there's a 95% chance most folks fall within 2 standard deviations of that average. So, somewhere between Rs. 10,000 and Rs. 50,000, right?
normalised: A recent survey by the National Statistical Office (N-S-O) shows that the average household income in Mumbai is about rupee thirty thousand per month, with a standard deviation of rupee ten thousand. They're saying there's a ninety five percent chance most folks fall within two standard deviations of that average. So, somewhere between rupee ten thousand and rupee fifty thousand, right?

unnormalised: The Met Department's predicting a 70% chance of heavy rainfall in Kerala this week. Better prepone your trip if you were planning to visit! Remember last year, the floods caused so much havoc, with a probablity of like, 99% that travel plans got totally messed up.
normalised: The Met Department's predicting a seventy percent chance of heavy rainfall in Kerala this week. Better prepone your trip if you were planning to visit! Remember last year, the floods caused so much havoc, with a probability of like, ninety nine percent that travel plans got totally messed up.

unnormalised: Speaking of stats, Bollywood's been buzzing about the box office collections. "Pathaan" had a, like, 90% probability of being a blockbuster, given the star cast and all the hype. Trade analysts predicted it, and they were bang on! Guess data doesnâ€™t lie, huh?
normalised: Speaking of stats, Bollywood's been buzzing about the box office collections. "Pathaan" had a, like, ninety percent probability of being a blockbuster, given the star cast and all the hype. Trade analysts predicted it, and they were bang on! Guess data doesn't lie, huh?
